stimulusHtml: Two groups of students each construct a sketch to predict the kinetic energy of a falling object that is subject to air resistance as it falls. Which group has produced a correct graph, and how can this selection be justified?
choicesHtml: Group 1 because the slope of an object’s kinetic energy graph is proportional to its acceleration.
Group 1 because the object’s speed is increasing at a decreasing rate, so its kinetic energy is also increasing at a decreasing rate.
Group 2 because it shows that the kinetic energy decreases as the magnitude of its acceleration decreases.
Group 2 because as the object falls it will approach a terminal speed which is where the speed reaches a horizontal asymptote.
